intro: Hieracium anadromodes, commonly known as the wandering hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium anadromodes is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural areas.
